function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Skilled workers can shift to online work, while lower income workers may not have this choice, leading to differential exposure to contagious diseases.","Impact":"Increased risk of contagion for lower income workers, exacerbating social divisions and inequality.","Mitigation":"Ensure access to protective measures and support for lower income workers, and promote equitable distribution of public health resources.","Technologies":"Telecommuting technologies, public health monitoring and support systems.","People":"Lower income workers, knowledge economy workers, general public.","Owner":"Government agencies, employers, public health organizations."},{"Description":"Economic and social divisions may be exacerbated by the shift to telecommuting, leading to unequal use of public spaces and segregation based on class, education level, or income.","Impact":"Further social division and segregation in public spaces, creating political and moral dilemmas for urban design and investment.","Mitigation":"Promote inclusive urban design, equitable access to public spaces, and policies that address social and economic inequalities.","Technologies":"Urban planning and design tools, community engagement platforms, public space monitoring systems.","People":"People in lower income brackets, urban planners, policymakers.","Owner":"Urban planning organizations, government agencies, community organizations."},{"Description":"COVID-19 challenges the traditional activities of public spaces, such as shopping and socializing, leading to potential changes in behavior and interactions in public areas.","Impact":"Disruption of traditional public space activities, impacting social interaction and economic activity.","Mitigation":"Promote safe and adaptive use of public spaces, support alternative forms of socialization, and invest in online platforms for economic transactions.","Technologies":"Public space monitoring systems, online social platforms, e-commerce technologies.","People":"General public, urban residents, business owners.","Owner":"Local government, community organizations, business associations."}]}
